Deficiency Narrative: A child received a cut under his eye as a result of an altercation with another child.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent from administrator. Each staff signed the memo. Thompson's Residential Treatment Center staff will continue to keep children separated from each other until both sides have had time to cool off. If they start arguing again outside of the home. One kid will be asked to go into the house. If they start arguing inside the home, they will be separated. Staff will have time to intervene and minimize injuries. The compliance can be found in the document library.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care ran from the operation twice in one day.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent from the administrator regarding staff supervision. TRTC will do its best to discourage clients from running or leaving from the property. Staff will follow the client for a half of mile. Staff will talk to the client to encourage the child/children to return home. If child refuse to return home, staff will call the police department to inform them which direction the child is headed. Staff will have 24 hours to debrief the child in care.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not follow child's service plan. The child's is to remain within eyesight of staff.
Correction Narrative: On 8/20/2024 Thompson Residential Treatment Center had a meeting with staff to discuss the importance of following each child's service plan. During waking hours staff will be in close proximity while being at the facility. During sleeping hours staff will do room check every 15 minutes. If a child leaves from the operation. Staff will complete a debrief form.  The staffing form can be found in document library.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation did not conduct a debriefing with the child in care.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent from the administrator with the operation debriefing form. The debriefing form can be found in the document library.

Deficiency Narrative: All the service plans reviewed had the same information and wording used for the supervision section.   This was not specific to each child and that child's needs.
Correction Narrative: An email was sent by the administrator. Thompson's RTC has created a structure approach to create individualized treatment plans for children in care.  The treatment director will conduct thorough assessments for each child including psychological eval, behavioral assessment and medical history. The treatment director and treatment team will identify the unique needs, strengths and preferences of each child through interviews with them and their families. The plan can be found in the document library.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff failed to intervene in an altercation between two children that resulted in a child being injured.
Correction Narrative: I, RCCR Tommie Moore spoke with the administrator regarding the citations for supervision. Mr. Thompson's stated that staff will continue to keep the two clients separated from one another until both sides had time to cool off. If they start arguing outside of the home. One kid will be asked to go into the house. If they start arguing inside the house, they will be separated. This is so staff would have time to intervene and minimize injuries.

Deficiency Narrative: The operation is working in conjunction with Lone Oak ISD to make sure that all of youth's educational needs are met. Thompson's Residential will provide school supplies and assist as needed with schoolwork, homework and school projects. To ensure the youth does not fall behind in school. Thompson's Residential Treatment Center will coordinate with teachers and/or counselor to make sure each child is encouraged to attend the Advisory Period which allows time for work to be caught up on during the school day. Thompson's Residential Treatment Center will also assist in scheduling tutorial time and providing transportation to and from as needed. Youth will be encouraged to communicate with their teachers and staff at Thompson's Residential Treatment Center.
